awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research: Fundamental Support for GPS Research - UNAVCO Facilities
awd_abstract_narration: 9813700  Bock         Global Positioning System (GPS) technology allows near  real-tine determination of position anywhere on Earth with  precision in the sub-centimeter range. It is making a profound  impact on understanding of diverse scientific problems in the  geosciences, including plate motions, earthquake cycles, crustal  dynamics, volcanic processes, glacier dynamics, sea level changes,  and atmospheric sensing. This award provides funding to support  part of the infrastructure needed for GPS-based studies by earth  scientists. The University NAVSTAR Consortium (UNAVCO) provides  infrastructure support in a number of areas, including data  archiving and data analysis. This award to the University of  California at San Diego, a member of the UNAVCO Consortium, will  support an archival data base from regional GPS networks that will  be available on-line to the geophysics research community.  ***

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
